indicators.Indicator: Make sure all teachers are marked in the system. check in/check out
Is the classroom temperature comfortable and is the air fresh?
Cleanliness of the classroom upon entry.
The classroom is prepared for the weekly theme (bookcase, bulletin board, tabletop, décor).
Positive classroom atmosphere: children are engaged, well behaved.
TE bags are checked & sorted (change of clothes, bottles, lunch bags, diapers, toys, etc)
Bottles are counted and filled with water.
Tables are properly sanitized 2 min before kids.
Check the cleanliness of the bathrooms and the room.
Tables and under tables are clean after meals.
Check kitchenette, cubbies, dishwasher and plates/utensils for cleanliness.
Compliance with the RATIO.
Compliance with RATIO/ZONING (during outdoor time).
Children’s allergies and dietary preferences are taken into account and followed.
Tables are clean after meals.
Compliance with the RATIO.
Check if one teacher can stay for nap time (and assist if needed).
Check kitchenette: food stored properly, pots washed. cubbinets, dishwasher and plates/utensils are clean
Copies and materials are prepared before the start of the lesson.
Lesson plans are prepared every Thursday (for the following week).
Monitor teacher check-out and review records.
Ensure parents are informed of all necessary situation.
Has the trash been taken out? Floors are clean Mon, Tue, Thu.
Toys are put away from the playground / wood chips are cleared rooster has food and water.
Check for forgotten items and bring them inside.
Check if the children have been given snacks.
Check the cleanliness of the bathrooms and the room.
Tables and under tables are clean after meals.
Water bottles are washed and filled.
Check if the children are brushed.
Check if the children have been changed into clean clothes after nap time.
Check if sunscreen has been applied.
Check for the presence of sun hats and appropriate clothing.
Compliance with the RATIO.
Compliance with RATIO/ZONING (during outdoor time).
Children’s allergies and dietary preferences are taken into account and followed.
Beds, boxes, shelves, hooks, and diapers are labeled.
Has the bulletin board, Family Corner, and Birthday Corner been updated?
Preparation for Special Events: decorations, children's songs, art & craft, props & costumes
Active participation in decorating rooms and spaces before holidays.
Timely check‑in & check‑out /Punctuality (Be ready on time)
Kind and friendly behavior with children and parents
Addressing accidents/incidents properly (reporting to admins/parents / talk to child / circle time)
Prep for learning time and professional implementation/ Cleaning, laundry, desinfection
Code of conduct
Timely toileting/ diaper change and mandatory water breaks
Warning notice(s).
Parking Zone Check.

Maintain emotional control and stability in all activities for the wellbeing of children, families, and staff
Answer calls, reception, emails, inquiries; schedule tours; send invitations; prepare materials
Address parent/staff concerns, resolve issues, inform director, and document if needed
Assist in processing and organizing tuition payments, billing, time sheets and invoices while managing enrollment, withdrawals, waitlists, re-enrollment, and children’s files
Handle hiring: ads, screening, interviews, new hire paperwork, training, and staff files
Maintain daily calendar, communicate schedule/changes with staff and owner, notify director of appointments and enrollments

Conduct short staff meetings and training sessions while providing professional, emotional, and practical support to staff in their daily work, focusing on guidance and assistance rather than discipline
Conduct daily classroom observations, provide feedback/discipline/coaching, support staff reviews, prepare classroom reports, and use DOT to monitor teacher responsibilities
Prepare rosters, logs, timesheets; maintain staff and children’s schedules/attendance
Communicate positively with parents about accidents and students’ needs, and organize field trips, events, and conferences.
Download/edit/organize classroom photos and send monthly albums to parents
Participate in marketing, recruiting, and event preparation
Copy, scan, and procure teacher-requested materials
Complete additional assignments from supervisor
Verify children’s attendance daily; confirm absences and notify parents
Ensure staff check-in/out on time; send reminders for signatures
Confirm daily check-outs and record late pick-ups
Provide classroom substitution for breaks or ratio needs; optimize staffing efficiency
Conduct and document fire drills; update emergency info and monitor first aid supplies
Assist with sick/injured students, perform health checks, enforce sick policy, and notify parents
Monitor parking ordinance and ensure children’s safety during drop-off and pick-up
Manage administrative time effectively to balance duties and priorities
Be at the gate, know each child’s needs and day, and greet parents warmly
Conduct morning cleanliness and air check (use checklist)
Ensure weekly menu has sufficient food; confirm delivery, freshness, and proper storage
Ensure ordering, receiving, distribution, and inventory of all school supplies
Ensure daily food distribution and enforce hygiene standards
Ensure diaper changes are monitored; children are clean, groomed, and bottles refilled
Ensure kitchen, facilities, and premises are clean and safe
Ensure kitchen tasks: check refrigerator for spoiled food, take out trash, refill water, clean coffee machine, turn off A/C, and lock doors
Inspect classrooms for cleanliness, bulletin boards, organization, supplies, and labels
Collect and manage lost & found items
Support teachers with classroom/program needs and materials
Maintain and monitor attendance, schedules, and timesheets
Ensure lobby is clean, organized, cozy, with fresh air and TV on
Ensure plants are watered and school pets are fed
Ensure tea and coffee are available for staff
Ensure photos are updated and displayed
Ensure communication board and family photo wall are maintained and up to date
Monitor indoor and outdoor environmental conditions—including cleanliness, air quality, temperature, lighting, and licensing requirements—and ensure appropriate actions
Create and distribute the school’s monthly newsletters
Monthly Teacher’s Meeting (agenda)
Special Events
Transition of the students
Charge Late Fees in App
Monthly Fire/ Earthquake drills
Update and maintain the school’s bulletin board with relevant information
Display signs related to school closures, school news, and other important updates
Ensure that all required licensing forms and notices are posted as per regulations
Photo Albums
